alert.note: Alert for Clare; Isabella; Kent; Lake; Mason; Mecosta; Montcalm; Muskegon; Newaygo; Oceana; Osceola; Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 04 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan, southwest Michigan and west central Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Clare, Isabella, Mecosta, Montcalm and Osceola. In southwest Michigan, Kent and Ottawa. In west central Michigan, Lake, Mason, Muskegon, Newaygo and Oceana. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rounds of thunderstorms will move through the area tonight and tomorrow morning and may produce flooding of small creeks and poor drainage areas. Recent heavy rains have left soils saturated and rivers running high. With an additional 1.0 to 1.5 inches of rain expected in most areas north of I-96, the water levels on the Muskegon and Chippewa rivers will remain high for several more days. If rain totals end up being closer to 2.0 to 2.5 inches tonight, more significant flooding can be expected to develop on the rivers in central Michigan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clare; Isabella; Kent; Lake; Mason; Mecosta; Montcalm; Muskegon; Newaygo; Oceana; Osceola; Ottawa
